question: Rhinophyma occurs due to-
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Hypertrophy of sebaceous glands Rhinophvma (potato tumor)o Rhinophyma is large, bulb-shaped, red-colored (ruddy) nose. It is a slow growing benign tumor due to hypertrophy of the sebaceous glands. o The cause of rhinophyma is unknown, though it is thought to be a severe form of acne rosceao Rhinophyma was once thought to be caused by heavy alcohol consumption, but this is not the case. Rhinophyma occurs equally in those who do not drink at all and those who drink large quantities of alcohol. o It mostly affects men past middle age. ed/pink colour of the tumor is due to engorgment of superficial vessels. Treatmento Surgery to reshape the nose is the best known treatment for rhinophyma. o Surgery may be done with a laser (carbon dioxide laser), scalpel (sharp knife) or a rotating brush (dermabrasion)and the area is allowed to re-epithelialize. o Sometimes, tumour is completely excised and the raw area is skin-grafted.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: In evaluation of a case of immotile nasal cilia, which of the following investigations should prove useful?
exp: Ans. is 'd' i. e., Nitric oxide test Screening tests for immotile cilia syndromeo Saccharine test: Saccharin or another substance is placed in the nose, and the speed of transport into the nasopharynx is measured to calculate mucociliary clearance (used infrequently because of awkwardness and dubious reliability). o Nitric oxide: Measuring exhaled nasal nitric oxide, which is mostly reduced in primary ciliary dyskinesia, is a good screening test for immotile-cilia syndrome with a good negative predictive value. Studies have demonstrated a relationship between nasal nitric oxide levels, nasal oxide synthase m. RNA expression, and ciliary beat frequency. There is also a significant inverse correlation between the degree of aplasia and/or hypoplasia of the paranasal sinus and nasal nitric oxide values in primary ciliary dyskinesia patientso Mucociliary transport, which is reduced in these patients, can be measured in situ by administering an inhalation aerosol of colloid albumin tagged with technetium Tc 99.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Presenting symptom of nasal myiasis is-
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Severe irritation with sneezing Clinical features of nasal myiasiso Initial symptoms (3-4 days maggots). Intense irritation, sneezing, headache, blood stained disharge, lacrimation. Later Maggots may crawl out of nose and there is foul smell. Nasal myiasis (Maggots in nose)o It results from the presence of ova of flies particularly chrysomia species in the nose which produce ulceration and destruction of nasal structure. Mostly seen in atrophic rhinitis when the mucosa becomes insensitive to flies laying eggs inside. Clinical featureso Initial symptoms (3-4 days maggots):- Intense irritation, sneezing, headache, blood stained disharge, lacrimation. o Later:- Maggots may crawl out of nose and there is foul smell. Complicationso Destruction of nose, sinuses, soft tissues of face, palate and eyeballo Fistulae in nose and palateo Death occurs due to meningitis. Treatmento Chloroform water or vapor must be instilled in order to anaesthetize or kill the maggots and so release their grip from the skin.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Local anaesthetic used for nasal surgery:
exp: (c) Both(Ref. Cummings, 6th ed., 482). Most common local anaesthetic used for nasal surgery (septoplasty) is 2% xylocaine (along with adrenaline) for local infiltration and 4% xylocaine for nasal packing (for doing nasal endoscopy). Cocaine is one of the most potent anesthetic agent and vasoconstrictor. These two characteristics make it an ideal medication for use during nasal surgery (here there is no need to give adrenaline) to decrease bleeding and pain. However because of its toxicity Cocaine paste use in nasal surgeries has decreased.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Rhinolith can cause -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i. e., All the above Rhinolitho A rhinolith is a calculus present in the nasal cavity. o The word is derived from the roots rhino- and -lith, literally meaning "'nose stone". It is an uncommon medical phenomenon, not to be confused with dried nasal mucus, o A rhinolith usually forms around the nucleus of a small exogenous foreign body, blood clot or secretion by slow deposition of calcium and magnesium salts, o Over a period of time, they grow into large irregular masses that fill the nasal cavity, o They may cause pressure necrosis of the nasal septum or lateral wall of nose, o Rhinoliths can cause nasal obstruction, epistaxis, headache, sinusitis and epiphora.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Bony septal perforation is seen:
exp: Ans: A (Syphilis) Ref: Diseases of the Ear. Nose and Throat by PL Dhingra. 5th edn. 2010 page 166. Explanation: Septal Perforation. Most common cause is trauma which can he due to surgery like SMR, cauterization for epistaxis, nose picking etc. Perforation in cartilaginous part. Lupus. Tuberculosis. Leprosy. Syphilis causes destruction of bony septum. Wegners disease causes total destruction. Also seen in workers exposed to chromic plating, soda ash manufacturing and those exposed to arsenic. Other causes like: Nasal myiasis. Rhinolith Septal abscess. Prolonged use of cocaine. Prolonged use of steroid sprays. Small perforations cause a whistling sound on inspiration and expiration whereas large ones will cause crusting and epistaxis. Treatment consists of treating the cause, alkaline nasal douches for removing the crusts, local flaps or sialastic buttons for closure.
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Rhinophyma is associated with?
exp: ANSWER: (A) Hypertrophy of the sebaceous glands. REF: Bolognia 2nd ed Ch-38. Rhinophyma is the "end stage" of sebaceous overgrowth and scarring from poorly controlled acne rosacea. It is predominantly seen in men age 40 and older. The word rhinophyma comes from the Greek language: rhinis meaning nose and phyma meaning growth. Rare cases have also been noted to involve the ears. This skin condition is frequently referred to as the "W. C. Fields" nose or potato nose. Rhinophyma consists of hypertrophic nodular growths on the distal half of the nose. The nose becomes very fibrous and inflamed, often becoming deep red or purple in color due to diffuse telangiectasias. Treatment: Rhinophyma is best treated with surgical ablation of the tissue. Cases with minimal involvement can easily be treated with electrosurgery. In moderate to severe cases, carbon dioxide laser surgery provides the best cosmetic improvement. Additionally a vascular laser (532 nm PDL) can be used to restore normal skin color. The goal of treatment is to return the nose to a pre diseased appearance and function
topic_name: Disease of External Nose & Nasal Septum

question: Percentage of newborn with deviation of nasal septum-
exp: Ans- C 20% Reference- Neonatal septal deviation is quite common, being present in approximately 20% of all newborns. Greater amount of birth trauma, like in primiparas, instrumental deliveries or emergency LSCS, and high birth weight predisposes more to neonatal septal deviation and increases the incidence. Strut test being a simple, non-invasive, and fairly accurate is quite useful for diagnosis of Neonatal septal deviations. The test can be carried out by a trained nurse or ANMs at the peripheral centres and positive NSD cases can be referred for proper management
